bdy.p:
Linda Harasim is a Professor of Communication, Faculty of Applied Sciences, at
Simon Fraser University in Burnaby, British Columbia. She holds a B.A. and M.A. from the
University of Alberta , and a
Ph.D.
in
educational theory
from the
University of Toronto .

She has been active for over a decade in researching educational applications of computer networking. She has designed, implemented, and evaluated networking applications in Canada, the U.S., and Latin America. She is also leading the Virtual-U Project, one of the first networked multimedia learning systems in the world that is customized for course delivery and course enhancement at all levels of education.
